de.intarsys.security.smartcard.pcsc

Class PCSCConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.intarsys.security.smartcard.pcsc.PCSCConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPCSCConnection

    public class PCSCConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPCSCConnection
    The default IPCSCConnection implementation.

      • controlMapped

        public byte[] controlMapped(int code,
                   byte[] inBuffer,
                   int inBufferOffset,
                   int inBufferLength,
                   int outBufferSize)
                     throws PCSCException
        SCardControl with a prior mapping of control codes. This is because control codes are defined differently in Win* and PCSClite environments. This is further complicated by the fact that in a terminal server environment we may BELIEVE to use Win* but really need PCSClite control codes for accessing the card terminal.
        Specified by:
        controlMapped in interface IPCSCConnection
        Parameters:
        code -
        inBuffer -
        inBufferOffset -
        inBufferLength -
        outBufferSize -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        PCSCException

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(int disposition)
                throws PCSCException
        Description copied from interface: IPCSCConnection
        Disconnect this connection. It is not valid to use this connection from now.
        Specified by:

      • getStatus

        public void getStatus()
               throws PCSCException
        Description copied from interface: IPCSCConnection
        Dummy "no op" call. This is used as a keep alive currently only as Windows PC/SC resource manager will kill the resource after some idle time.
        Specified by:
        getStatus in interface IPCSCConnection
        Throws:
        PCSCException

      • transmit

        public byte[] transmit(byte[] apdu,
              int apduOffset,
              int apduLength,
              int recvLength,
              boolean sensitiveContent)
                throws PCSCException
        Description copied from interface: IPCSCConnection
        Send bytes to the card. In extension to the PC/SC API we introduce a flag if the content sent to the card may be logged to some device. The default implementation can log all communication.
        Specified by:
        transmit in interface IPCSCConnection
        Returns:
        Throws:
        PCSCException
